substantial_discussion: A student was criticized while reading this American textbook in public. Nanchu takes this book as an example, of how volatile the attitude towards studying English was, even/especially (?) at the East China Normal University's Foreign Languages Depar
mentions it among others as an important reading for him and his zhiqing fellows
mentions it among others as an important reading for the whole development in the field of literature after 1978
Xu Xiao read Ticket to the Stars and was very much influenced by it
Zhao Yifan copied Ticket to the Stars and handed it to Xu Xiao
Shu Ting wants to go to Gorky‘s „Universities“ during her rustication

Gao Hua mentions that during the turmoil years of CR, when as a son of "heiwulei" (five black categories) he has been living in the bottom of the society, receiving supercilious looks and being discriminated against, these two books by Gorky acted as his spiritual guides.
They started reading neibu books before rustication time already. Kafka's "Trial" was among the most influential neibu books for Bei Dao
Zhao Yifan gave the book as a shouchaoben to Xu Xiao
He cited a story that Lu Xun once wrote to Xu Guangping about a tiger. "To be or not to be", not to surrender to the evilness and enemy became his motto.
The author found the book left by two educated youth from other unit, so he hid in his dorm reading it for the reason of illness and starved all through.
The author read this banned book and thought Marx's works explains better than this one.
This book triggered up the author's understanding of literature, intellectual, society and the era.
Xu Xiao received The New Class as a shouchaoben from Zhao Yifan
He cited a story that Lu Xun once wrote to Xu Guangping about a tiger. "To be or not to be", not to surrender to the evilness and enemy became his motto.
He came up with the idea of editing quotations of Lu Xun after reading Letters between two
Lu Xun as his most important literary inspiration

During the early period of the CR Wu was transferred from one place to another for investigation. He found a shouchaoben copy signed Liu Xun there, and memorized the entire collection. He was trasferred to the Film Academy (still under arrest) where he put Lu Xun's collection on paper. The copy was found and confiscated by the supervisor.
for the next two years, he read much Lu Xun, esp. Essays
in 1967 he compiled 鲁迅语录 not for publications but for his friends
Later the author's home was plundered as well, all of his collections were confiscated by the red guards.
The author read the peom of Baudelaire （Le Balcon 露台／阳台） at this time when so many foreign peoms appeared again in public.

In a morning of the summer in 1984, the author visited Chen Jingrong, and she showed him a collection of her translation in the 1960s, and these Poems were once published on "World Literature", which had influenced Bei Dao and other poets at that time.
The author started to translate these works
The author remembered that there was a worker whose surname was Zhu. He wrote many poems and mentioned these poets very often
big influence
modernism such as Baudelaire influences the way he writes poetry
